definition: the gates of hell
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan

sentences.english: Anyway, I hadn't yet done what I'd come back to do.
sentences.chinese: 況且，我也還沒幹完我從鬼門關回來該做的事。

sentences.english: The firemen rescued the little girl form the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 這起事故的受害者是被人從鬼門關裏搶救出來。

sentences.english: A family dog rescued a newborn boy from the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 一隻家養犬把一個新生男嬰從鬼門關救了回來。

sentences.english: International breaks are a nervous time for managers.
sentences.chinese: 國際比賽日對於經理們來說是個鬼門關。

sentences.english: If you work too many hours your job can become the jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 假如你工作太多小時，你的工作將把你帶入鬼門關。

sentences.english: Through the gate of hell from outer space, life urn colleagues preserved fish head boat.
sentences.chinese: 自過鬼門關外天，命同人鮓甕頭船。

sentences.english: His drug addiction was so bad that it became his jaws of death.
sentences.chinese: 他的賭癮太深了，讓他到了鬼門關。

definition: the world of the living
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to make prompt decisions (idiom)
to notify/to inform
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
single-log bridge/(fig.) difficult path
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to stop/to obstruct
